Name: Ancient Burial Sites
Type: At the start of the agenda phase
Rules Text: Choose 1 player. Exhaust each cultural planet owned by that player.
Flavour Text: The images depicted a race that Rin had never seen before. Curious. Could it be that this was a race that was exterminated by the Lazax?

Name: Archaeological Expedition
Rules Text: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control; gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.
Flavour Text: Hiari pressed the activation flyphs, and the ancient door hissed open. As she stepped into the pitch-black interior of the Mahact tomb, she felt a shiver of anticipation. Perhaps, finally, she would find the Codex.

Name: Assassinate Representative
Rules Text: Choose 1 player. That player cannot vote on this agenda.
Flavour Text: With a sickening crunch of bone and metal, unit.desgn.FLAYESH extracted its stinger from the blood-drenched skull of the Jol-Nar councilor.

Name: Blitz
Type: At the start of an invasion
Rules Text: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have Bombardment gain Bombardment 6 until the end of the invasion.
Flavour Text: "T-these weren't meant to be used like this. T-this is a t-terrible idea." Tai mumbled, wringing his hands. "Well 'course it is," Dart grinned, slamming his fist down on the release lock. "But we've got about sixty kilotons of 'surprise' and nothing to lose!"

Name: Bribery
Type: After the speaker votes on an agenda
Rules Text: Spend any number of trade goods. For each trade good spent, cast 1 additional vote for the outcome on which you voted.
Flavour Text: "We think that this initiative would spell disaster for the galaxy, not just the Creuss." Taivra said, quietly slipping Z'eu an envelope. "Don't you agree?"

Name: Bunker
Type: At the start of an invasion
Rules Text: During this invasion, apply -4 to the result of each Bombardment roll against planets you control.
Flavour Text: "Elder Junn crossed his arms and steadied his breathing. The bombs could not reach them, not this far down. At least, that is what the soldiers had told him."

Name: Confounding Legal Text
Type: When another player is elected as the outcome of an agenda
Rules Text: You are the elected player instead.
Flavour Text: "Unfortunately," Cinnabian said in a level voice, "the Galactic Council requires the dispute be arbitrated by a truly neutral party. As the Titans were still slumbering when your war began, we will oversee your negotiations... instead of your friends on Jord."

Name: Confusing Legal Text
Type: When you are elected as the outcome of an agenda
Rules Text: Choose 1 player. That player is the elected player instead.
Flavour Text: "Somehow, even after the Council had adjourned, none of them any closer to understanding the strange and confusing events of the day."

Name: Construction Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 space dock from your reinforcements on a planet you control.
Flavour Text: "The vote was nearly unanimous. The Council would provide funding for the restoration. Ciel was furious."

Name: Counterstroke
Type: After a player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens
Rules Text: Return that command token to your tactic pool.
Flavour Text: "That's the thing about loyalty - " Viktor mused, turning one of the pieces backward, facing its own side. "It can be bought."

Name: Coup D'etat
Type: When another player would perform a strategic action:
Rules Text: End that player's turn; the strategic action is not resolved and the strategy card is not exhausted.
Flavour Text: Artuno shoved the slug pistol into Huro's face as armored mercenaries stormed into the office. "I'm afraid the station's undergoing a change in management."

Name: Courageous to the End
Type: After 1 of your ships is destroyed during a space combat
Rules Text: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, your opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their ships.
Flavour Text: "Coughing up blood and covered in burns, Havvat collapsed against the rapidly overheating ship core. She smiled. She would be remembered."

Name: Cripple Defenses
Rules Text: Choose 1 planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet.
Flavour Text: "Titanic vines burst forth from the ground, wrapping themselves around the system's primary firing cylinder, breaking it free from its moorings, and bringing it crashing down upon the installation below."

Name: Deadly Plot
Type: During the agenda phase when an outcome would be resolved
Rules Text:
If you voted for or predicted another outcome, discard the agenda instead; the agenda is resolved with no effect and it is not replaced.
Then, exhaust all of your planets.
Flavour Text: The hooded envoy erupted into a nightmare of black metal, lunging at the shocked diplomats.

Name: Decoy Operation
Type: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your structures
Rules Text: Remove up to 2 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on a planet you control in the active system.
Flavour Text: Enemy fire lashed the abandoned positions on the ridgeline as Trilossa's flock slipped unseen around their flanks.

Name: Diplomacy Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains a planet you control. Each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in that system.
Flavour Text: "Ciel evaluated the other senators. Weak, all of them. This was his game to win."

Name: Diplomatic Pressure
Rules Text: Choose another player; that player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
Flavour Text: 1. The Arborec emissary leaned close, and Brother Milor flinched at the faint whiff of decay. "You do not understand," Dirzuga Ohao rasped. "You must support this measure."|2. Brother Milor shook his head. "The Brotherhood can not support your war against this extra-dimensional threat." Dirzuga Ohao raised an eyebrow. "Are you certain?"|3."It would be unfortunate," the Arborec Dirzuga said, "if your supplies of diraxium were to dry up. How would your fleet defend you if we stopped supplying its fuel?"|4."Damn you!" Brother Milor hissed. "You leave us no choice but to fight in your war." Dirzuga Ohao smiled, dead skin stretching over her teeth.

Name: Direct Hit
Type: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
Rules Text: Destroy that ship.
Flavour Text: 1. There it was! An opening! Neekuaq gestured wildly, a rare display for one normally quite reserved. "Fire the main battery!"|2. The Loncara Ssodu's main battery flared to life, firing a volley directly into the flickering starboard shields of the Letnev dreadnought.|3. For a moment, it looked as if the dreadnought's shields would hold, but a moment later the ship began to come apart where the attack had pierced its hull.|4. Neekuaq watched, satisfied, as the ship was wracked by a series of explosions from within, huge armored plates and other debris hurtling off into the darkness.'

Name: Disable
Type: At the start of an invasion in a system that contains 1 or more of your opponents' PDS units
Rules Text: Your opponents' PDS units lose Planetary Shield and Space Cannon during this invasion.
Flavour Text: "Ssruu has met their systems and fixed them." Ssruu dropped a handful of ripped wires and broken circuitry on the pedestal before Q'uesh Sish. "He will await his next task aboard his ship."'

Name: Distinguished Councilor
Type: After you cast votes on an outcome of an agenda
Rules Text: Cast 5 additional votes for that outcome.
Flavour Text: "Elder Junn was a wonder to behold. He knew the name of every senator, made small talk effortlessly, and commanded attention when he spoke. Magmus hated everything about him."

Name: Divert Funding
Rules Text:
Return a non-unit upgrade, non-faction technology that you own to your technology deck.
Then, research another technology.
Flavour Text: "I am sorry, Academician," Arbiter Berekon shrugged. "I am sure psychoarchaeology is an interesting subject, but the supreme leader feels your budget would be better spent on more militaristic research."

Name: Economic Initiative
Rules Text: Ready each cultural planet you control.
Flavour Text: "Large sums of Hacan currency flowed freely into the project, and somehow, defying all logic, the returns were even greater."

Name: Emergency Repairs
Type: At the start or end of a combat round
Rules Text: Repair all of your units that have Sustain Damage in the active system.
Flavour Text: "What do you mean 'It's fine!?'" Dahla said, nearly tripping over a damaged bulkhead as the ship rocked from the explosive barrage.

Name: Experimental Battlestation
Type: After another player moves ships into a system during a tactical action
Rules Text: Choose 1 of your space docks that is either in or adjacent to that system. That space dock uses Space Cannon 5 (x3) against ships in the active system.
Flavour Text: "Arm the relay!" Mendosa bared his fangs. "The Saar will not submit!"
Notes: The space dock fires at the same time as other Space Cannon units.

Name: Exploration Probe
Rules Text: Explore a frontier token that is in or adjacent to a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.
Flavour Text: With a dull thud, the probe shot from the cruiser and accelerated into the writhing maelstrom of the gravity rift. Admiral DeLouis paced on the bridge. Hopefully, this time the probe would return.

Name: Fighter Conscription
Rules Text: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or units that have capacity; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.
Flavour Text: T'esla grinned as her shimmering vessel lifted off the flight deck - at last, that damned Viscount would experience the superiority of Naalu dogfighting. "Get ready," she hissed into the comms.

Name: Fighter Prototype
Type: At the start of the first round of a space combat
Rules Text: Apply +2 to the result of each of your fighters' combat rolls during this combat round.
Flavour Text: Suffi vaulted excitedly off the prototype's sleek, azure wing, landing effortlessly in its cockpit. ""Let's see those damn snakes keep up with us now!""

Name: Fire Team
Type: After your ground forces make combat rolls during a round of ground combat
Rules Text: Reroll any number of your dice.
Flavour Text: Grinning, Jael spun toward the familiar noise of heavy boots hitting the ground. Backup had arrived.

Name: Flank Speed
Rules Text: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.
Flavour Text: 1. Mendosa smirked. "Don't ye fret now, girl. It sounds like ye've got somewhere to be in a hurry, and it just se happens that I ken get ye there right quick."|2. There was a low-pitched hum throughout the station and the gigantic, bulky constructions on the hull spat blue flame. Massive ion thrusters! So this was how the Saar moved the damn things.|3. With a sound like thunder and a flash of neon blue light, the thrusters accelerated full bore, nearly knocking Suffi off her feet.|4. Mendosa grinned at the young Mentak pilot's astonishment. "Mobility-the Clan's greatest strength. Ye'd be amazed at how fast this thing ken go."

Name: Focused Research
Rules Text: Spend 4 trade goods to research 1 technology.
Flavour Text: Stunned, Rin looked over the data, scarcely able to believe what he was seeing. It was nothing short of a major breakthrough. The Headmaster would be pleased.

Name: Forward Supply Base
Type: After another player activates a system that contains your units
Rules Text: Gain 3 trade goods. Then, choose another player to gain 1 trade good.
Flavour Text: All eyes turned toward the darkening skies as the only surviving supply truck rolled through the gates. "Get these checked in and send the last shipment to our allies!" Harrugh yelled over the din of the engines.

Name: Frontline Deployment
Rules Text: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.
Flavour Text: The soldiers poured fire on the writhing mass, but as each tendril vaporized, two more took its place. Panic wormed into the troopers' minds; was the creature growing?

Name: Ghost Ship
Rules Text: Place 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other players' ships.
Flavour Text: Reports of Creuss vessels sighted in the area had surely been exaggerated. After all, the Creuss had no business this far from the Shaleri passage, and usually kept to themselves.

Name: Ghost Squad
Type: After a player commits units to land on a planet you control
Rules Text: Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.
Flavour Text: The L1 advance team was expecting to find the outpost abandoned. What they found - unfortunately for them - was Connor.

Name: Hack Election
Rules Text: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to the right of the speaker and continues counterclockwise.
Flavour Text: YOUR [NULL ID] STATELY GAME WILL BE FOR NAUGHT<< [VAR:42687] ORDER WILL ARISE FROM [VAR:89001] CHAOS<< IT IS OUR HAND THAT CONTROLS THE OUTCOME

Name: Harness Energy
Rules Text: Replenish your commodities.
Flavour Text: "Manipulating the cosmos was a power reserved for the gods." Rowl spat at the ground as his contraption whirred to life. "Not anymore."

Name: Imperial Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 victory point.
Flavour Text: In a sweeping victory that surprised absolutely no one, the Winnu representative singlehandedly elected himself to oversee the analysis of a recently uncovered Lazax data cache.

Name: Impersonation
Rules Text: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective.
Flavour Text: "Also," Connor continued, bemused. "Someone just handed me this as I was leaving. I think it was meant for our dear friend Sucaban. We should be able to put it to good use."

Name: In The Silence Of Space
Rules Text: Choose 1 system. During this tactical action, your ships in the chosen system can move through systems that contain other players' ships.
Flavour Text: The Barony ships seemed to defy reality, bending light around them at impossible angles-naught but inky-black contours could be seen.

Name: Industrial Initiative
Rules Text: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control.
Flavour Text: The Gashlai reactors proved to be extremely effective. With the conversion rate practically doubled, the factories' output was immense.

Name: Infiltrate
Type: When you gain control of a planet
Rules Text: Replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.
Flavour Text: The 1X had scarcely interfaced with the mainframe before it belonged to them completely.

Name: Insider Information
Rules Text: Look at the top card of the agenda deck.
Flavour Text: M'aban yawned. Another filibuster. Politics could be so flavorless at times. Besides, she already knew how this one was going to turn out. Not well. Not well at all...

Name: Insubordination
Rules Text: Remove 1 token from another player's tactic pool and return it to their reinforcements.
Flavour Text: Kilik had never been particularly good at following orders. It only seemed natural to get paid for exercising that trait, as long as she didn't think too hard about where the money was coming from.

Name: Intercept
Type: After your opponent declares a retreat during a space combat
Rules Text: Your opponent cannot retreat during this round of space combat.
Flavour Text: The space before the fleeing ship shimmered and warped, revealing the bow of the *Y'sia Yssrila* bearing down on its position. There would be no escape today.

Name: Leadership Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 3 command tokens.
Flavour Text: Rev's impassioned speech stunned the other councilors. Perhaps there was more to these humans they had initially thought.

Name: Lost Star Chart
Rules Text: During this tactical action, systems that contain alpha and beta wormholes are adjacent to each other.
Flavour Text: The ship's sensors showed that the ancient star-map had somehow led them beyond the Mahact plateau.

Name: Lucky Shot
Rules Text: Destroy 1 dreadnought, cruiser, or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control.
Flavour Text: The missile—an insignificant spark against the darkness—struck the hull of the dreadnought. Moments later, the starboard flank erupted in flames.

Name: Maneuvering Jets
Type: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
Rules Text: Cancel 1 hit.
Flavour Text: 1. Something was wrong. T'esla sensed a flicker of movement on the planet's surface, followed by a faint glint of light. Reflexively, she veered her fighter to the side-an action that saved her life.|2. The fighter's thursters boosted her just out of the cannon's firing solution, and a metal slug the size of a building rocketed past her crystalline ship.|3. T'esla breathed a sigh of relief as the massive slug disappeared into the distance. A touch slower and she would have been annihilated.|4. The flickering red warning lights on her control panel reflected in her scales as she regained her composure. "Well," she said aloud. "Zat was close."

Name: Manipulate Investments
Type: At the start of the strategy phase:
Rules Text: Place a total of 5 trade goods from the supply on strategy cards of your choice; you must place these tokens on at least 3 different cards.
Flavour Text: "But my good fellow," the envoy sputtered. "Surely you can't expect me to agree to those prices!" Durruq leaned in close. "Check again. You may find your goods are trading for less than you think."

Name: Master Plan
Rules Text: You may perform an additional action this turn.
Flavour Text: Viktor laced his long fingers with a wicked smile. Unlenn would be proud. The tactician's reputation was well-earned; even pawns could unseat kings.

Name: Mining Initiative
Rules Text: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of 1 planet you control.
Flavour Text: To support its voracious war machine, the N'orr empire cracked the planet's crust and began mining its very core.

Name: Morale Boost
Type: At the start of a combat round
Rules Text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
Flavour Text: 1. Harrugh stood before his warriors, searching for the words that would express the pride that swelled within him.|2. "We have done the impossible. I am proud to call you my brothers. My equals. My betters." Harrugh's whiskers bristled with energy as he spoke.|3. "Today we turn these invaders to ash and take back what is ours!" Harrugh paused, noting the murmurs of approval rippling through the ranks.|4. The whispering gradually died down and his warriors watched Harrugh expectantly. Every muscle in his body tensed, and he thrust his gyro-spear skyward."For Kenara!"

Name: Nav Suite
Rules Text: During the "Movement" step of this tactical action, ignore the effect of anomalies.
Flavour Text: "The field is too thick!" Sikosk gasped. Trrakan's plume flared. "Not for me, and not for Iruth." A flick of his talon, and the destroyer flipped and dove for the asteroid field.

Name: Parley
Type: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
Rules Text: Return the committed units to the space area.
Flavour Text: The human admiral returned to his ship, struggling to remember precisely how his meeting with the Collective had gone.

Name: Plagiarize
Rules Text: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by 1 of your neighbors; gain that technology.
Flavour Text: The Yssaril spies handed over their prize to Connor, who in turn passed it to the Sol engineers with a grim smile. "Now then, boys," he said, one hand on his rifle, "about those loose ends..."

Name: Plague
Rules Text: Choose 1 planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.
Flavour Text: The letani dipped a mossy limb beneath the surface of the reservoir, feeling the flow of the particles within, shifting them, changing them into something different. Something dangerous.

Name: Political Stability
Type: When you would return your strategy card(s) during the status phase
Rules Text: Do not return your strategy card(s). You do not choose strategy cards during the next strategy phase.
Flavour Text: The Winnu councilor breathed a sigh of relief. This opportunity would not be wasted. The peace of the Lazax was within grasp.

Name: Politics Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 3 action cards and gain the speaker token.
Flavour Text: The Dirzuga had managed to negotiate themselves into a position of power amongst the other councilors, all of whom still looked terribly uncomfortable in their presence.

Name: Public Disgrace
Type: When another player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase
Rules Text: That player must choose a different strategy card instead, if able.
Flavour Text: In the months that followed the report, the Council was quick to censure the Jol-Nar for their unethical practices.

Name: Rally
Type: After you activate a system that contains another player's ships
Rules Text: Place 2 command tokens from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.
Flavour Text: The Federation advance would not be halted - not today. Claire set her broadcast to play on all open channels. She began, her voice fierce and unwavering "Friends! On this day, our names shall be inscribed in the pages of legend!"

Name: Reactor Meltdown
Rules Text: Destroy 1 space dock in a non-home system.
Flavour Text: Flames engulfed the shipyard, a vortex of fire and shrapnel that left nothing untouched.

Name: Refit Troops
Rules Text: Choose 1 or 2 of your infantry on the game board; replace each of those infantry with mechs.
Flavour Text: Sek'kus leapt from the trenches, the plasma projectors on her Valkyrie exoskeleton howling as they scoured the field ahead of her.

Name: Reflective Shielding
Type: When one of your ships uses Sustain Damage during combat
Rules Text: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships in the active system.
Flavour Text: Prit scrambled up Hesh's shoulder, gleefully clapping as the entropic shielding tore the mercenary cruisers apart.

Name: Reparations
Type: After another player gains control of a planet you control
Rules Text: Exhaust 1 planet that player controls and ready 1 planet you control.
Flavour Text: Gil oversaw the reconstruction of the Hacan outpost, but neglected to inform the N'orr representative that the damage was not nearly as severe as he was led to believe.

Name: Repeal Law
Rules Text: Discard 1 law from play.
Flavour Text: Eventually, the N'orr diplomat came to an agreement with Hacan Garrus, and the embargo was repealed. Still, he couldn't shake the feeling that Garrus had gotten the better end of the deal.

Name: Reveal Prototype
Type: At the start of a combat
Rules Text: Spend 4 resources to research a unit upgrade technology of the same type as 1 of your units that is participating in this combat.
Flavour Text: Varish and Cole completed the final linkages, activating the field harvester. The cruiser's beams roared with renewed power, cutting through the enemy ship.

Name: Reverse Engineer
Type: After another player discards an action card that has a component action
Rules Text: Take that action card from the discard pile.
Flavour Text: Xuange spread their hands over the captured harvester. Mirroring their careful gestures, dark energy fields unfolded and began delicately disassembling the device.

Name: Rise of a Messiah
Rules Text: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet you control.
Flavour Text: Harrugh stood atop the dunes, looking down at the thousands of Hacan warriors mustered below. Gathering his strength, he let loose a mighty roar, the will of his people throughout the galaxy echoing forth from within.

Name: Rout
Type: At the start of the "Announce Retreats" step of space combat, if you are the defender
Rules Text: Your opponent must announce a retreat, if able.
Flavour Text: Vuil'raith fleshships swarmed the weary defenders, sending unease and sweeping through the telepathic links. But Z'eu projected a powerful feeling of calm, and the Naalu fighters began to drive the Cabal back toward the rift.

Name: Sabotage
Type: When another player plays an action card other than Sabotage
Rules Text: Cancel that action card.
Flavour Text: 1. Q'uesh Sish tapped her claws impatiently. "You were sssaying?" But the confused Jol-Nar envoy stood silent. It was as if the words had escaped his thoughts entirely.|2. trjn.desgn.ALIZARIN introduced itself to each data node, incorporating them into its platform, expunging any data it deemed a threat to the Virus.|3. unit.desgn.BEELZEBUL followed the group of men through the winding hallways until they stopped at an intersection. Investigators would later find its cracked oculus at the center of a smoking crater, singed, but still functioned.|4. Unlenn smashed a clenched fist into the bulkhead, green eyes ablaze with rage. The entire plan had been turned on its head. Such incompetence was unfathomable.

Name: Salvage
Type: After you win a space combat
Rules Text: Your opponent gives you all of their commodities.
Flavour Text: When the Coalition raiders had finally returned to their ships, scarcely a bolt remained to salvage from the destroyed vessel.

Name: Sanction
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome returns 1 command token from their fleet supply to their reinforcements.
Flavour Text: Two can play at this game.

Name: Scramble Frequency
Type: After another player makes a Bombardment, Space Cannon, or Anti-Fighter Barrage roll:
Rules Text: That player rerolls all of their dice.
Flavour Text: "I will not accept this from that worthless scum!" Feng growled as his enigmatic companion interfaced with the ship's nav suite. The Memoria's position flickered and shifted, and the blast flashed harmlessly by.

Name: Scuttle
Rules Text: Choose 1 or 2 of your non-fighter ships on the game board and return them to your reinforcements; gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those ships.
Flavour Text: Rear Admiral Farran saluted as he watched the blasted starship being towed to the scrap yard. "You served me well," he whispered. "Now you can serve the Barony once more."

Name: Seize Artifact
Rules Text: Choose 1 of your neighbors that has 1 or more relic fragments. That player must give you 1 relic fragment of your choice.
Flavour Text: Armored dropships crashed into the main dock. Hatches blew open, and Captain Mentarion and her commando raider charged into the facility's heart.

Name: Shields Holding
Type: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
Rules Text: Cancel up to 2 hits.
Flavour Text: 1. The blast from the enemy's main cannon slammed into the space in front of the warship, splitting into two streams across the bow.|2. T'ro stared unflinching at the incoming barrage through the bridge's observation deck. The shields would hold.|3. The ship's shields sizzled and sparked but remained active despite the heavy assault.|4. As the assault died down and it became clear that the ship sustained no major damage, T'ro clicked his mandibles in anticipation. "Return fire!"

Name: Signal Jamming
Rules Text: Chose 1 non-home system that contains or is adjacent to 1 of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.
Flavour Text: Meian was practically aglow, wisps of her ether crackling with delight. It was amazing what could be achieved with a well-timed electromagnetic discharge.

Name: Skilled Retreat
Type: At the start of a combat round
Rules Text: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; the space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.
Flavour Text: 1. In an instant, the Sol fleet vanished from the Barony's scanners.|2. The Creuus fleet was gone. No trace remained of their passage.|3. T'ro gave the order, and the entire fleet withdrew without question.|4. "We have no choice, captain." Ciel looked nervous. "We must retreat."

Name: Solar Flare
Rules Text: During this movement, other players cannot use Space Cannon against your ships.
Flavour Text: Meian braced for combat as the fleet entered the Ordinian system, but there were no Valefar droneships waiting to meet them. The solar flare gambit had succeeded - they were completely undetected.

Name: Spy
Rules Text: Choose 1 player. That player gives you 1 random action card from their hand.
Flavour Text: "I'm no spy," Connor said, casually stuffing the data drives into his pack. "Now, how can I get out of here without being seen?"

Name: Summit
Type: At the start of the strategy phase
Rules Text: Gain 2 command tokens.
Flavour Text: At the end of the twelfth day, Rev returned home from the summit in New Moscow feeling physically exhausted and mentally drained. But she was also satisfied. They had a plan-finally-and it was a good plan.

Name: Tactical Bombardment
Rules Text: Choose 1 system that contains 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment. Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system.
Flavour Text: A6's red eyes flickered with activity, and a string of numbers flashed briefly across the screen before he spoke. "Bombardment complete. All enemy installations have been neutralized."

Name: Technology Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, research 1 technology.
Flavour Text: The Council granted the Yin funding to research an effective countermeasure to combat the virus. After all, keeping the Yin occupied with the virus meant killing two birds with one stone.

Name: Trade Rider
Rules Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 5 trade goods.
Flavour Text: The Letnev councilor begrudgingly accepted the N'orr's core mining contract, if only so that the "gracious" Hacan senator didn't secure yet another source of income for his clan.

Name: Unexpected Action
Rules Text: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board and return it to your reinforcements.
Flavour Text: M'aban's voice was barely a whisper, cracking as hundreds of flashing lights appeared on her scanner. "We've been tricked."

Name: Unstable Planet
Rules Text: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.
Flavour Text: Another quake shook the planet, and a wave of dirt and rock rose up to swallow the Tekklar legion.

Name: Upgrade
Type: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your ships
Rules Text: Replace 1 of your cruisers in that system with 1 dreadnought from your reinforcements.
Flavour Text: "More guns?" Connor shook his head. "Not more guns. Let's try something bigger."

Name: Uprising
Rules Text: Exhaust 1 non-home planet controlled by another player. Then, gain trade goods equal to its resource value.
Flavour Text: Harrugh leapt down from the ledge, gyro-spear blazing in the sunlight. In front, the L1Z1X began to take notice. Behind, his warriors stood at the ready. Win or lose, this would be the end.

Name: Veto
Rules Text: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. players vote on this agenda instead.
Flavour Text: Magmus batted the now charred corpse aside with the back of his golden gauntlet. "The Muuat reject your proposal."

Name: War Effort
Rules Text: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.
Flavour Text: The N'orr may not be the most proficient shipwrights, but the willingness of their citizens to do their part far exceeds that of the other great races.

Name: War Machine
Type: When 1 or more of your units use Production
Rules Text: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.
